required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: EEG Data Collection to Evaluate New Patient State Index Performance
clinical_study.official_title: EEG Data Collection to Evaluate New Patient State Index Performance

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, single-center, cohort study in patients undergoing surgical procedures to collect data using Masimo SedLine EEG device in order to evaluate a newer version of PSI measurement against an older version of PSI measurement.

primary_outcome.measure: Wake up times, PSI 1.X vs. PSI 2.X
primary_outcome.description: Compare the length of time from when the anesthesia have ended to the time of Return of Consciousness (ROC) between the PSI 1.X group and the PSI 2.X group.

other_outcome.measure: Total Anesthesia Drug Used, PSI 1.X vs. PSI 2.X
other_outcome.description: Compare the total amount of anesthesia drug used between the PSI 1.X group and the PSI 2.X group.

other_outcome.measure: Frequency of Somatic Events, PSI 1.X vs. PSI 2.X
other_outcome.description: Compare the frequency of somatic events between the PSI 1.X group and the PSI 2.X group.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive the Sedline sensor. The anesthesiologist will be blinded to the PSI Rev 1.X score and the raw EEG data from the Masimo device. Anesthesia management will be in accordance with standard of care protocols and procedures.
The anesthesiologist will be monitoring subjects using an old version of PSI (Rev 1.X).
The anesthesiologist will be monitoring subjects using a new version of PSI (Rev 2.X).

intervention.description: PSI Rev 1.X is an older version of the PSI measurement.
PSI Rev 2.X is a newer version of the PSI measurement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA status of I, II, or III.
- Subjects undergoing general surgery.
- neurologically intact patients (e.g. no history or presence of traumatic brain injuries, neurological diseases, etc.).
Exclusion Criteria:
- subjects with any deformities, diseases, or for any other reason that may present proper fit and application of SedLine sensors.
- inability to obtain subject's physiological, vital, demographics, and real time anesthesia data.
- Subjects who are pregnant.
- known history of drug abuse.
- subjects deemed not suitable for study at the discretion of the Principal Investigator.
